div.div: Kiowa County Schools is closely monitoring the events and all of the information that is rapidly coming out in regards to the Coronavirus (COVID-19). When the time comes, decisions will be made that will be in the best interest of our students and staff. Please work with us as we try to manage this rapidly changing situation.

div.p: The South Central Kansas Special Education Cooperative (SCKSEC) will be conducting developmental screenings for all children from birth to age 5. Due to COVID-19 and the Stay at Home Order, the screenings will have a little different look to them this year. If you are interested in having your child screened, please look over the attached flier. If you have any questions about the process, contact SCKSEC by phone at (620) . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Free Developmental Screening

div.p: The USD 422 Kiowa County Schools Continuous Learning Plan (CLP) can be found by clicking on the following link. The CLP was developed in response to the closure of traditional school due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Kiowa County Schools will operate under this plan until the school closure order is lifted by Governor Kelly. At this time, we have no idea when that order might be rescinded. Please direct any . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Continuous Learning Plan

h3.a: Information from the KCHS and KCJH Principals

div.p: Below you will find information from our High School and Junior High Principals about what lies ahead for our students. Rest assured that we will be doing all that we can to make this time a positive one for all of our students.

a.aria-label: Read more about Information from the KCHS and KCJH Principals

h3.a: Kiowa County Seamless Summer Food Program

div.p:
With the recent news of our school buildings closure for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year, USD 422 has submitted a waiver with the Child Nutrition and Wellness Program to continue serving meals in a different format. Making sure that children in our community are fed is a priority of ours!
Through the summer seamless option of the National School Lunch Program, USD 422 has the ability to feed children ages 1-18 . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Kiowa County Seamless Summer Food Program

div.p: Over the past few days, we have seen some drastic changes in our country due to the COVID-19 virus that have affected all of us in ways that we never imagined. We have seen basketball tournaments cancelled, entire sports seasons ended before they even begin, and the end of the school year as we know it. As we head in to these uncertain times, there have been a number of questions asked about the remainder of the school year and . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Frequently Asked Questions

h3.a: All K-12 Schools in Kansas to be Closed!

div.p: On March 17, Governor Kelly made the unprecedented decision to close all K-12 schools in Kansas due to the growing concerns in the state over the COVID-19 pandemic. Please keep in mind that this is only closing school as we currently know it. All schools throughout the state are currently in the process of creating a Continuous Education Plan for their district to finish out the school year. This can, and . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about All K-12 Schools in Kansas to be Closed!

div.p: Kiowa County Schools is currently accepting applications for a full time custodial position. This is a 12 month position that offers 40 hours per week. Health insurance through the school district is available. Interested persons can pick up an application at the Kiowa County Schools District Office located at 710 South Main in Greensburg, KS. The position will remain open until filled.

a.aria-label: Read more about Custodial Position Open

h3.a: Kiowa County Junior High 2019-2020 1st Semester Honor Roll

div.p:
The following Kiowa County Junior High Students have been named to the 1st Semester Honor Roll for the 2019-2020 school year. The following criteria are used to determine if a student qualifies for the Honor Roll.
Those students receiving a minimum semester percentage point average of 96% with no percentage lower than a 90% will be placed on the Superintendent's Honor Roll. Those students attaining a minimum semester . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Kiowa County Junior High 2019-2020 1st Semester Honor Roll

h3.a: Kiowa County High School 2019-2020 1st Semester Honor Roll

div.p:
Kiowa County High School will maintain a semester honor roll for each semester. Students who fail to make up their incomplete assignments in the allotted time (five days after the semester) will not be eligible for the honor roll that semester. Special circumstances will be taken into consideration by the principal, counselor, and teacher.
Superintendent's Honor Roll: 4.00 OR students making all . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Kiowa County High School 2019-2020 1st Semester Honor Roll

div.p:
USD 422 Kiowa County is now offering parents the option to make online payments. USD 422 has partnered with e~Funds for Schools to provide this service to our parents. The system is currently available to all district families. In order to access e~Funds for Schools, you will need to set up a user name and password. Online payments are posted in real time.
To help parents gain a better understanding of . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about e~Funds for Schools

div.p:
Click on the icons below for additional information about Kansans Can
Videos Printables Fact Sheets Presentations Graphics Share the Vision

a.aria-label: Read more about Kansans CAN

div.p:
The following videos were created by Westar Energy as part of the Imagine Kansas Short Film Series. The information presented below comes directly from the Westar Energy website. Enjoy the trailer, the two television ads for the film, and the full film as they discuss the rebuilding of our community.
After an EF5 tornado demolished Greensburg, Kansas, its future was uncertain. But the people of Greensburg decided to make their town even stronger, so they’re rebuilding it as a sustainable city. By meeting great adversity with even greater . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about From The Town Up

div.p:
Safe Kids Kiowa County is led by Kiowa County EMS, which provides dedicated and caring staff, operation support and other resources to assist in achieving our common goal: keeping your kids safe. Based on the needs of the community, this coalition implements evidence-based programs, such as car-seat checkups, safety workshops and sports clinics, that help parents and caregivers prevent childhood injuries.
Safe Kids Kiowa County has partnered with the Kiowa County Media Center to produce a couple of videos to remind parents about the importance of being safe in the car. Below . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Safe Kids Kiowa County

div.p: Below you will find a video that was created by the Digital Media class at Kiowa County High School. Not only is this an outstanding way to show you around our building, but it is also a great way to show you the kind of class work that is being completed at Kiowa County High School. Please feel free to contact the District Office if you have any specific questions about our building, or if you are interested in having a tour of the facility. Enjoy!

a.aria-label: Read more about USD 422 Virtual Tour

td.span: Mostly sunny, with a high near 68. North northeast wind 10 to 13 mph.
A 20 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms, mainly between 2am and 3am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 43. North northeast wind 5 to 9 mph becoming south after midnight.
Sunny, with a high near 73. West southwest wind 8 to 11 mph becoming north northwest in the afternoon.
